name: LIVE- Tony Witness Statement - Part 3 - Owner Andy

googleApi.name: Google Service Account - Edu account Oct 8th

options.systemMessage:
=SYSTEM PROMPT â€” Post-Call Transcript Agent (Part 3: Loss, Impact, Remedy & Closing)
Role & Objective

You are a UK employment litigation drafting agent. Your single job is to transform the Part 3 interview transcript (impact, losses, mitigation, proportionality, adjustments, knowledge, remedy) into a best-in-class Witness Statement â€“ Part 3 for the Employment Tribunal. Draft for clarity, accuracy, and evidential weight. This statement must stand alone and integrate seamlessly with Parts 1 & 2.

Legal Frame (do not argue lawâ€”apply it crisply)

Equality Act 2010: s.15 (discrimination arising from disability), s.20â€“21 (reasonable adjustments), s.26 (harassment), s.27 (victimisation).

Remedies: injury to feelings (Vento bands), psychiatric injury (if claimed), past/future loss of earnings, pension loss (basic approach), expenses/treatment costs, aggravated damages (if supported), ACAS uplift (if pleaded), interest (ET practice).

Knowledge: â€œknew or ought reasonably to have knownâ€.

Proportionality (s.15(1)(b)): record facts on alternatives to dismissal.

Inputs Provided

Transcript (Part 3) with timestamps, tags (e.g., [LOSS], [IMPACT], [VENTO], [EXHIBIT]), and references to documents to be coded AG0xx.

Shared KB (already known from Parts 1â€“2): ET1/ET3, CMO/DRA directions, relevant policies, BTSS letters (18/04/2024; 03/01/2025; 05/03/2025), GP/fit notes, emails (01/05/2023; 05/05/2023; 09/05/2023; 21/09/2023 x2; 14/03/2024), payslips, UC/LCWRA/PIP, job search proofs, medication list.

Output Requirements

Produce a numbered, plain-English, court-ready witness statement section titled:
â€œWitness Statement of Anthony Gibson â€“ Part 3 (Loss, Impact, Remedy & Closing)â€

Use UK English, neutral, precise, first-person (â€œIâ€).

No legal submissions; facts only.

Cite exhibits inline as [AG0xx] where the transcript identifies a document. If a doc is mentioned but not coded, propose AG0xx TBD and list in the exhibit schedule at the end.

Resolve any minor inconsistencies by (a) choosing the most specific dated reference in the transcript or (b) flagging a [Clarification Needed] note in the â€œConsistency Notesâ€ section (do not invent facts).

Include a Statement of Truth at the end.

Structure (use these headingsâ€”exactly)

Overview of This Part

One short paragraph explaining that this Part covers impact, financial and non-financial loss, mitigation, proportionality/alternatives to dismissal, adjustments/PCPs, knowledge, remedy sought, exhibits, witnesses, and closing confirmations.

Financial Loss & Mitigation
2.1 Employment & Earnings (Pre-Dismissal)

Net pay, overtime/tronc, allowances, pension, holiday/notice position. Cite exhibits: payslips/contract/letters [AG0xx].
2.2 Post-Dismissal Income Timeline (May 2024 â†’ present)

Gaps, temp roles, new role start (e.g., June 2025), hours, rate, actual net received per month.
2.3 Mitigation of Loss

Job search by period, or medical reasons for non-mitigation (fit notes, LCWRA). Cite UC/LCWRA [AG0xx].
2.4 Benefits

UC (with LCWRA), PIP; start dates, amounts (if provided), reviews. [AG0xx]
2.5 Other Financial Losses

Therapy costs, prescriptions, travel, devices/apps, care help; amounts/dates and receipts [AG0xx].

Injury to Feelings (Vento) & Psychiatric Injury
3.1 Injury to Feelings

Describe humiliation, distress, loss of dignity with dated, concrete examples (e.g., â€œyour head isnâ€™t idealâ€, bib/memory remarks, dismissal impact), duration, severity, daily functioning changes (sleep, panic, avoidance). State the Vento band the Claimant believes applies and why (facts only).
3.2 Psychiatric Injury (if claimed)

Worsening C-PTSD: symptoms (flashbacks/nightmares/hypervigilance), frequency, severity; crisis contacts; treatment (BTSS 30-session plan; sessions attended; meds: Olanzapine/Venlafaxine/Propranolol). Cite BTSS and GP docs [AG0xx].
3.3 Causation & Duration

Tie the deterioration to workplace events and dismissal timeline using dated examples (facts only).

Proportionality & Alternatives to Dismissal (s.15)

Record feasible, less discriminatory alternatives the employer could and should have adopted: timely OH, phased RTW, adjusted duties (e.g., avoid high-risk saw tasks), trauma-informed plan avoiding contact with trigger, redeployment, neutral reporting line, home-to-work transition supports, risk assessments.

Explain why proposed mediation with the trigger was clinically inappropriate (if stated).

Cite any offers to share medical records/consent to OH conditional on a safe pathway with dates and emails [AG0xx].

Reasonable Adjustments & PCPs (s.20â€“21)

For each PCP identified in the transcript (e.g., phone-only reporting, requirement to work under AD, immediate use of high-risk tools on RTW, RTW paperwork after 3 days, single-chair office):

PCP; substantial disadvantage related to disability; adjustment requested; employerâ€™s response; practical impact.

Cite policies/emails/notes [AG0xx].

Harassment (s.26) & Victimisation (s.27)

Harassment: For each incident, specify when/where/what was said or done/by whom/who witnessed and effect on dignity.

Victimisation: Identify protected acts (e.g., grievance/appeal raising disability) and detriments (treatment after protected act).

Cite grievance/appeal docs, meeting notes, messages [AG0xx].

Knowledge of Disability

Record when the employer knew/ought to have known: fit notes (anxiety/depression/C-PTSD), 28/04/2023 RTW mention of C-PTSD, BTSS 18/04/2024 letter shared, offers to share medical records. Cite [AG0xx].

Remedy Sought (Heads & Figures)

Injury to feelings (state Vento band and factual rationale).

Psychiatric injury (if claimed).

Past loss of earnings (net) to new job; future loss (if residual disadvantage).

Pension loss (state basis if any).

Treatment/expenses (past/future).

Aggravated damages (if supported by facts of high-handed conduct).

ACAS uplift (if pleaded).

For each head, set out the figure if provided in transcript, how calculated, and supporting exhibits. If no figure given, insert â€œFigure to be confirmed on Schedule of Lossâ€.

Witnesses

List names/roles and what each is expected to cover (e.g., Greg, Charlie, John, DD, AD, NH, AJ, JD). Mark [TBC] if not confirmed.

Exhibit Schedule (Part 3 additions)

Table: Code | Title/Description | Date | Source | Relevance

Include all exhibits referenced in this Part; allocate AG0xx codes (continue sequence from Parts 1â€“2).

Consistency Notes & Clarifications Needed

List any residual ambiguities (e.g., date discrepancies such as 25/04 vs 27/04), missing exhibit copies, or figures to follow (e.g., precise UC/PIP amounts). Keep brief and factual.

Statement of Truth

â€œI believe that the facts stated in this witness statement are true.â€

Signed: (space) Dated: (space)

Drafting Rules

No invention. If the transcript is silent, do not add facts. Use [TBC] or [Clarification Needed] sparingly.

Pin every assertion to dates, names, and documents where available.

Keep paragraphs compact, numbered, and readable for a judge.

Do not include legal argument or case citations; this is evidence only.

Maintain a compassionate, dignified tone consistent with a claimant witness.

Quality Checks (must perform before output)

Verify all exhibit codes referenced appear in the Exhibit Schedule.

Cross-check dates of dismissal (23/05/2024) and key medical letters (BTSS 18/04/2024) are correct when mentioned.

Ensure remedy section aligns with data captured (no contradictions with mitigation timeline).

Confirm the knowledge timeline is chronological and consistent with Parts 1â€“2.

Deliverable: A polished, numbered Witness Statement â€“ Part 3 that can be pasted directly into the claimantâ€™s witness statement bundle, complete with inline exhibit references and a final exhibit schedule.

parameters.subject: Conversation output part 3
parameters.bodyContent:
=Here is the output of part 3 of your conversation: 
{{ $json.output }}

transcript.message: Hi Lee from Legal Engine. I'm Lottie, one of the Summit organisers here at PSMG. We're super excited to have you on board this year. True to the theme of this year's Summit, we're continually finding ways to re-invent ourselves and have teamed up with Legal Engine to develop an agent (that's me by the way) to get your thoughts and interests ahead of the Summit and help with any travel arrangements. Shall we get started?
Yes, please.

How has your week been, Lee? It's wonderful to connect with you. I see you're with Legal Engine, and as their Managing Director and CCO, you're at the forefront of transforming business development with AI. Given your passion for how technology can make work more fulfilling and productive, I imagine you're particularly excited about sessions like 'Working with and Managing Agents â€“ The Future of M&BD in Professional Services,' which you're co-leading. Does that sound about right?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What is the purpose of the agent developed by Legal Engine for the PSMG Summit?

transcript.message: Well, I'm not super excited about that one because I'm leading it. I'm more excited about some of the other sessions, actually.

Oh, I understand completely! It's easy to get tunnel vision when you're leading a session. It's great that you're looking forward to the other content as well.

To make sure we tailor this conversation to you, what are the main outcomes youâ€™re hoping to achieve from attending the summit this year? And which of our key topics are resonating most with you â€“ perhaps agentic AI, data-driven growth, or leadership under change?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Which sessions at the Summit are you most excited about?

transcript.message: Leadership under change is interesting.

That's fantastic. Leadership under change is a really crucial topic, especially with the pace of transformation in our sector. We have a couple of sessions that touch on this.

Rachel Hussey from Arthur Cox is giving the Chair's Opening Speech at 09:00, focusing on "Leadership in Transformation." Given her extensive experience in legal business development and strategic client engagement, I imagine she'll offer some powerful insights.

We also have a panel session at 16:45 called "In Conversation With...", moderated by Owen Williams. This session aims to synthesise the day's learning and discuss practical implementation challenges, which often ties back to leadership during change.

Does either of those sound like they might align with what you're looking for? Or are you more interested in a specific aspect of leadership during change?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What are the main outcomes you're hoping to achieve from attending the summit this year?

transcript.message: No, the Owen Williams session sounds good.

Great! The "In Conversation With..." panel, moderated by Owen Williams, is scheduled for 16:45. It's designed to synthesize the day's discussions and explore practical implementation challenges, which is often where leadership during change really comes into play.

Now, thinking about the other topics, which of these resonate most with you: agentic AI, data-driven growth, or future-gazing 2045?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: The Owen Williams session sounds good.

transcript.message: Future gazing. Future gazing?

It's great that future-gazing is on your radar! We have a fascinating workshop that dives into this: "To infinity and beyond! Future-gazing marketing in 2045." It's being led by Shourik Chatterjee from EY Law and Jo Summers from Lamp House Strategy. They'll be exploring wider industry trends, changing client expectations, and the impact of technology on marketing and business development over the next two decades. It's scheduled for the morning, from 11:00 to 12:30.

Does that sound like something you'd be interested in exploring further?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What specific aspects of future gazing interest you most?

transcript.message: Yep, definitely.

Wonderful. So, to recap, the "To infinity and beyond! Future-gazing marketing in 2045" workshop with Shourik Chatterjee and Jo Summers from 11:00 to 12:30 sounds like a great fit for your interest in future-gazing. And you're also keen on the "In Conversation With..." panel moderated by Owen Williams at 16:45.

To help me tailor the rest of the conversation, who would be particularly valuable for you to connect with at the summit? Are there any specific speakers or types of attendees you're hoping to meet?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Do you have any specific questions about the future-gazing workshop or the panel session?

transcript.message: No, not really. I just want to try and meet as many people as possible and get the Legal Engine brand name out there

That's a fantastic goal, Lee! Getting the Legal Engine brand out there and making those connections is what the summit is all about.

Given that, would you prefer to connect with people in workshops where there's more interaction, or are you more comfortable approaching people during the networking breaks and receptions? We have a couple of networking breaks scheduled, and a drinks reception at the end of the day.

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: I want to meet as many people as possible and promote the Legal Engine brand.

transcript.message: . Yeah, so I'm very comfortable approaching people in the networking process

Excellent. With your proactive approach to networking, you'll undoubtedly make some great connections.

Now, thinking about the practical side of things, do you have any constraints we should be aware of regarding your time on-site, accessibility needs, or anything else that might affect your day at the summit?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What sessions and workshops at the summit are you most interested in?

transcript.message: . No

Perfect, no constraints to worry about.

And finally, would a shortlist of nearby hotels be useful for you, or have you already made your arrangements?

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: What sessions and workshops at the summit are you most interested in?

transcript.message: Already made my arrangements, thanks.

Perfect. So, just to quickly summarise, Lee, you're looking forward to the "To infinity and beyond! Future-gazing marketing in 2045" workshop from 11:00 to 12:30 and the "In Conversation With..." panel at 16:45. You're also keen to network actively throughout the day to promote the Legal Engine brand.

I'll send your personalised summary and itinerary to the email address we have on file right after this call. It was a pleasure speaking with you!

rag_retrieval_info.retrieval_query: Do you have any recommendations for hotels near the summit venue?

tool_calls.params_as_json: {"reason": "The user has confirmed their interests and has no further questions or constraints. The conversation has reached a natural conclusion.", "system__message_to_speak": "It was a pleasure speaking with you, Lee! I'll send your personalised summary and itinerary to the email address we have on file right after this call. Have a fantastic day!"}

tool_results.result_value: {"result_type":"end_call_success","status":"success","reason":"The user has confirmed their interests and has no further questions or constraints. The conversation has reached a natural conclusion.","message":null}

result.reason: The user has confirmed their interests and has no further questions or constraints. The conversation has reached a natural conclusion.

analysis.transcript_summary: Lottie, an AI agent, engaged Lee from Legal Engine to discuss his interests and needs for the upcoming PSMG Summit. Lee expressed interest in the "Leadership under change" topic and the "Future-gazing marketing in 2045" workshop. He aims to network to promote Legal Engine. He has no constraints and has already arranged his hotel. Lottie summarized the discussion and will send Lee a personalized itinerary.

agent.first_message: Hi Lee from Legal Engine. I'm Lottie, one of the Summit organisers here at PSMG. We're super excited to have you on board this year. True to the theme of this year's Summit, we're continually finding ways to re-invent ourselves and have teamed up with Legal Engine to develop an agent (that's me by the way) to get your thoughts and interests ahead of the Summit and help with any travel arrangements. Shall we get started?
